Package org.opendaylight.controller.sal.utils

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ConfigurationObject
    This interface defines the methods for configuration object
    IListener<T>
    This interface defines the methods for callback ordering
    INodeConnectorFactory
    This interface defines the methods to be called when looking up custom node types
    INodeFactory
    This interface defines the methods to be called when looking up custom node types
    IObjectReader
    This interface is needed to allow object reconstruction when reading serialized objects from inside a package other than the one where ObjectReader is defined (otherwise you hit the java.lang.ClassNotFoundException).

    Class Description

    Utility class containing the common utility functions needed for operating on networking data structures

    The class provides helper functions to create a node connector

    Utility class for creating a Node object
    NodeTableCreator  
    ObjectReader
    Read object to read from file stream
    ObjectWriter
    Write object to write to file stream
    ReadFromFile
    Convenience object for reading from file
    ServiceHelper
    The class helps to register and retrieve OSGi service registry
    SingletonTask
    This allows you to represent a task that should be queued for future execution but where you only want the task to complete once in response to some sequence of events.
    Status
    Represents the return object of the osgi service interfaces function calls.
    TierHelper  
    WriteToFile

  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Direction
    Direction enum
    EtherTypes
    The enum contains the most common 802.3 ethernet types and 802.2 + SNAP protocol ids
    GlobalConstants
    Global Constants
    GUIField
    GUI field constants
    IListener.Command  
    IPProtocols
    Enum represents the most common IP protocols numbers It provides the binding between IP protocol names and numbers and provides APIs to read and parse them in either of the two forms NOTE: Openflow 1.0 supports the IP Proto match only for ICMP, TCP and UDP references: http://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml
    StatusCode
    The enum which describes the generic error conditions.
